title: Senior Research Fellow, 2 positions (Industrial Engineering and Management)
field: Business Administration, Industrial Economics, Industrial Engineering, Management, Strategic Management, and 1 moreSupply Chain Management
job_description: Tampere University and Tampere University of Applied Sciences create a unique environment for multidisciplinary, inspirational and high-impact research and education. Our universities community has its competitive edges in technology, health and society. www.tuni.fi/enThe Industrial Engineering and Management Unit (IEM) is looking to recruit two senior research fellows. IEM is part of the Faculty of Management and Business (MAB) at Tampere University and offers education in the fields of engineering at the BSc, MSc and doctoral levels. Researchers at IEM are known for their broad and multidisciplinary collaboration that addresses the latest societal challenges. We take part in multidisciplinary projects with the different faculties and research groups at Tampere University and actively collaborate with other Finnish and international universities and research institutes.The unifying theme of research at the IEM Unit is sustainable value creation in technology-driven organisations, through which our research is linked to four major global challenges: increasing complexity, changes in the logic of value creation, the need for sustainable development and social change. Our five research groups specialise in the following research areas:Profitability management, in particular the profitability effects of real processes, decision making and interventionist researchProject-based business and industrial services management, in particular the organisation and management of project activities, project networks and the service orientation of industrial enterprisesTechnology strategy and business, management of innovations, with particular emphasis on energy solutions and the circular economyProduction and supply chain management, in particular operations strategy, production location decisions, sustainable supply chains and value creation in industrial buyer-supplier relationshipsSafety management and engineering, with particular emphasis on the safety of organisations, products, production, and services in terms of people, the environment and property, and the development of safety in work and technologyJob description The senior research fellows will join the Industrial Engineering and Management Unit and, depending on their research interests and experience, one of the five research groups listed above. The successful candidates will perform the following tasks in their respective areas of expertise: conduct independent research, secure external funding for own and research groupâs research and participate in national and international research collaborations;responsibility for teaching offered by the unit, e.g., in the areas of operations and supply chain management, BSc seminars and/or problem-based learning in the area of business management;supervise students writing their theses;participation in the other activities of the unit and the research group.The senior research fellowsâ specific teaching and research orientation will be discussed and agreed with the candidates during the recruitment process. Requirementsdoctoral degree in industrial engineering and management or equivalent;strong teaching skills;track record of independent research in the field of the position;ability to manage research projects and secure external funding.The position of senior research fellow requires at least some years of post-doctoral research experience, a strong publication record and previous involvement in acquiring research funding. We appreciate international experience and experience of working with companies. We expect candidates to be committed to delivering high-quality teaching and have a serious intent to develop as researchers and members of an international scientific community. The position requires fluency in the English language and readiness to teach and interact with companies and stakeholders in the Finnish language.The following criteria are used in screening the applications:Suitability to the research domain of one or more of the research groups in the unitMotivation and goals for the positionsAchievements in research and teachingLevel of ambition, clarity and feasibility of the research strategyWe offerThe positions will be filled on a permanent basis. The planned starting date is 1 June 2022 or as mutually agreed. A trial period of six months will apply.The salary will be based on both the job requirements and the employeesâ personal performance in accordance with the Finnish University Salary System. The position of a senior research fellow is placed on the job demand levels 6-7 (teaching and research staff).We offer you the opportunity to join our active, innovative and international community.
